name: under-construction
description: I have a number of personal side projects, but not all are ready to release.  It would be nice to have a default "Coming Soon" page I could put on a url, instead of the default namecheap.com splash page, or a dead link.

comments.organization: Scripts are broken out by components.  Static assets, css, js, and html are all handled separately since this is a static content application
comments.primary commands: Commands that are not prefixed with an asset type {css, js, static, etc} are the primary commands.
comments.command organization: static assets are handled by bash, css is handled by sass for preprocess and postcss for post-processing.  Webpack handles js, and running a local dev server.

scripts.lint: npm run static:lint && npm run css:lint && npm run js:lint
scripts.build: npm run wipe && npm run lint && npm run static:build && npm run css:preprocess && npm run css:postprocess && npm run js:build
scripts.watch: npm run wipe && npm run static:build && npm run css:preprocess && concurrently --kill-others "npm run js:watch" "npm run css:watch"
scripts.deploy: bash -c 'aws s3 rm s3://under-construction/ --recursive && aws s3 cp ./dist s3://under-construction/ --recursive && aws cloudfront create-invalidation --distribution-id E2F85ORQR3T6ZX --paths "/*"'
scripts.push: npm run build && npm run deploy

author: Robert Christ
browserslist: > 0.2%, last 2 versions, Firefox ESR, not dead
